info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 1:38PM EDT until April 3 at 11:20PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio...
Eagle Creek Above Findlay affecting Hancock County.
For the Eagle Creek (Hancock)...including Findlay...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Eagle Creek above Findlay.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to late this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Eagle Creek will overrun its banks and begin to inundate portions of Fremont and Graceland Avenue. Water will inundate a field near Rosemont Drive.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.1 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/cle.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE THIS EVENING
